page.title: 14FARMING (cont. 2)
page.content: The largest farm,{Hillside Farm}is 620 acres. It consists of 353 acres of cereals,200 acres of pasture,20 acres of rough grassland and 47 acres of woodland. Mr. Jackson distributes his entire milk production (368,000 litres from 210 cows) to local houses in one pint bottles. Part of his grain production is used for cattle feed. The rest is exported to Spain, the Middle East and Russia. Mr. Jackson also has a transport business. His vehicles travel approx. 2000 miles each week. Some deliver general goods in the United Kingdom. Others move equipment from Peterlee, Durham to Rotterdam in Holland, Dusseldorf in West Germany, Paris in France and Milan in Italy.
